Articles.Content:
Is there any possible way I can virtually delete the planets from the files, so that they're not there anymore? I have a bad computer (26 GB left iMac, model 2010/2009) and I REALLY need to reduce lag. Thanks, and have fun. - GabeN

I also haven't been on the forums awhile. Here's why;

TEAM. FORTRESS. 2.:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D

26GB left?

Computing strength isn't really based on memory capacity.

Short answer, no.

Some mods (which will increase load on your machine, actually) can modify the Kerbol system extensively (or minutely).

Perhaps you've been at the standard game settings, but if not, try reducing the various graphical settings. Personally I find that running at half-res and pushing the physics delta time/frame to .10 or .11 makes the game run much more bearably on a poor machine.

Well, do you know any mods that increase fps/reduce space required?

I probs actually meant my sh*tty graphics card. It sucks.

- - - Updated - - -

Perhaps you've been at the standard game settings, but if not, try reducing the various graphical settings. Personally I find that running at half-res and pushing the physics delta time/frame to .10 or .11 makes the game run much more bearably on a poor machine.

Nah, I've been running at minimum but still experience frequent fps drops.

KSP is mostly CPU intensive.

My 3.3Ghz rig handles KSP somewhat well.
